intro: Hyoseris pusilla, commonly known as the dwarf hawkweed, is a small flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its yellow flowers bloom in clusters, and it often thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats. Hyoseris pusilla is known for its rapid growth and ability to colonize various environments.
